instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet; cook until softened.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, and red wine (if using).
Simmer sauce for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve sauce over cooked spaghetti, topped with grated Parmesan cheese.
tips: For extra flavor, add a splash of balsamic vinegar to the sauce.
Leftover sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days, or frozen for longer storage.

instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, grated ginger, cornstarch, and water to make the sauce.
Heat a large skillet or wok over high heat. Add a drizzle of oil.
Add sliced chicken breast to the skillet and stir-fry until browned and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
Add more oil to the skillet if needed. Stir-fry broccoli florets, sliced bell pepper, and julienned carrot until tender-crisp.
Return cooked chicken to the skillet. Pour sauce over chicken and vegetables; stir until everything is coated and sauce has thickened.
Serve hot over cooked rice.
tips: For a spicier stir-fry, add sliced red chili peppers or a dash of sriracha sauce to the sauce mixture.
Feel free to customize with your favorite vegetables such as snap peas, mushrooms, or baby corn.

instructions: Preheat oven to 475째F (245째C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to desired thickness.
Transfer dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over dough.
Arrange slices of fresh mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven and sprinkle with fresh basil leaves before serving.
tips: For an extra crispy crust, preheat a pizza stone in the oven before placing the pizza on it.
Feel free to add additional toppings such as sliced tomatoes or olives.

instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Grill or pan-fry chicken until cooked through, about 5 minutes per side.
Let chicken rest for a few minutes, then slice into strips.
In a large bowl, toss chopped romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing until evenly coated.
Add sliced chicken, grated Parmesan cheese, and croutons to the bowl; toss to combine.
Serve immediately.
tips: For added flavor, toss croutons with a bit of olive oil and garlic powder before adding to the salad.
Feel free to add cherry tomatoes or avocado slices for extra freshness.

instructions: Preheat oven to 375째F (190째C).
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until well combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop tablespoon-sized balls of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them about 2 inches apart.
Bake in preheated oven for 8-10 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Allow cookies to cool on baking sheets for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.
tips: For extra chewy cookies, slightly underbake them; for crispier cookies, bake them a bit longer.
Add chopped nuts or dried fruits for variation.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon cornstarch dissolved in 2 tablespoons water
instructions: In a small bowl, mix together soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch mixture; set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger to the skillet; stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli florets, sliced bell pepper, julienned carrot, snap peas, and sliced mushrooms to the skillet; stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables and stir until well combined and sauce has thickened.
Serve hot over cooked rice.
tips: Feel free to add tofu, chicken, or shrimp for added protein.
Garnish with chopped green onions or sesame seeds before serving.
